verses.text:
Arise for our help,
and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is inditing a good matter:
I speak of the things which I have made touching the king:
my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art fairer than the children of men:
grace is poured into thy lips:
therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty,
with thy glory and thy majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies;
whereby the people fall under thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever:
the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness:
therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia,
out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings’ daughters were among thy honourable women:
upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear;
forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so shall the king greatly desire thy beauty:
for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift;
even the rich among the people shall intreat thy favour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s daughter is all glorious within:
her clothing is of wrought gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework:
the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought:
they shall enter into the king’s palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children,
whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations:
therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is our refuge and strength,
a very present help in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed,
and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though the waters thereof roar and be troubled,
though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God,
the holy place of the tabernacles of the most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved:
God shall help her, and that right early.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved:
he uttered his voice, the earth melted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, behold the works of the Lord,
what desolations he hath made in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be still, and know that I am God:
I will be exalted among the heathen,
I will be exalted in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O clap your hands, all ye people;
shout unto God with the voice of triumph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord most high is terrible;
he is a great King over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall subdue the people under us,
and the nations under our feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall choose our inheritance for us,
the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is gone up with a shout,
the Lord with the sound of a trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing praises to God, sing praises:
sing praises unto our King, sing praises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is the King of all the earth:
sing ye praises with understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God reigneth over the heathen:
God sitteth upon the throne of his holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes of the people are gathered together,
even the people of the God of Abraham:
for the shields of the earth belong unto God:
he is greatly exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God,
in the mountain of his holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount Zion,
on the sides of the north, the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is known in her palaces for a refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, lo, the kings were assembled, they passed by together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They saw it, and so they marvelled;
they were troubled, and hasted away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear took hold upon them there,
and pain, as of a woman in travail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish with an east wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As we have heard, so have we seen
in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God:
God will establish it for ever. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have thought of thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
According to thy name, O God, so is thy praise unto the ends of the earth:
thy right hand is full of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let mount Zion rejoice, let the daughters of Judah be glad,
because of thy judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Walk about Zion, and go round about her:
tell the towers thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mark ye well her bulwarks, consider her palaces;
that ye may tell it to the generation following.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this God is our God for ever and ever:
he will be our guide even unto death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, all ye people;
give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
both low and high,
rich and poor, together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth shall speak of wisdom;
and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will incline mine ear to a parable:
I will open my dark saying upon the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil,
when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that trust in their wealth,
and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
none of them can by any means redeem his brother,
nor give to God a ransom for him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(for the redemption of their soul is precious,
and it ceaseth for ever:)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that he should still live for ever,
and not see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he seeth that wise men die,
likewise the fool and the brutish person perish,
and leave their wealth to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not:
he is like the beasts that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This their way is their folly:
yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave:
for he shall receive me. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be not thou afraid when one is made rich,
when the glory of his house is increased;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for when he dieth he shall carry nothing away:
his glory shall not descend after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though while he lived he blessed his soul:
and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall go to the generation of his fathers;
they shall never see light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man that is in honour, and understandeth not,
is like the beasts that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mighty God, even the Lord, hath spoken,
and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence:
a fire shall devour before him,
and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth,
that he may judge his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather my saints together unto me;
those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the heavens shall declare his righteousness:
for God is judge himself. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices
or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take no bullock out of thy house,
nor he goats out of thy folds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For every beast of the forest is mine,
and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know all the fowls of the mountains:
and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I were hungry, I would not tell thee:
for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will I eat the flesh of bulls,
or drink the blood of goats?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Offer unto God thanksgiving;
and pay thy vows unto the most High:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and call upon me in the day of trouble:
I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But unto the wicked God saith,
What hast thou to do to declare my statutes,
or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seeing thou hatest instruction,
and castest my words behind thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him,
and hast been partaker with adulterers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou givest thy mouth to evil,
and thy tongue frameth deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother;
thou slanderest thine own mother’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now consider this, ye that forget God,
lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso offereth praise glorifieth me:
and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness:
according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wash me throughly from mine iniquity,
and cleanse me from my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I acknowledge my transgressions:
and my sin is ever before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against thee, thee only, have I sinned,
and done this evil in thy sight:
that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest,
and be clear when thou judgest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I was shapen in iniquity;
and in sin did my mother conceive me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts:
and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean:
wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make me to hear joy and gladness;
that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide thy face from my sins,
and blot out all mine iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Create in me a clean heart, O God;
and renew a right spirit within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast me not away from thy presence;
and take not thy holy spirit from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation;
and uphold me with thy free spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then will I teach transgressors thy ways;
and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation:
and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, open thou my lips;
and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it:
thou delightest not in burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit:
a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion:
build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness,
with burnt offering and whole burnt offering:
then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man?
the goodness of God endureth continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy tongue deviseth mischiefs;
like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou lovest evil more than good;
and lying rather than to speak righteousness. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God shall likewise destroy thee for ever,
he shall take thee away, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling place,
and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous also shall see, and fear,
and shall laugh at him:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God:
I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it:
and I will wait on thy name; for it is good before thy saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God.
Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity:
there is none that doeth good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
to see if there were any that did understand, that did seek God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy;
there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge?
who eat up my people as they eat bread:
they have not called upon God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!
When God bringeth back the captivity of his people,
Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save me, O God, by thy name,
and judge me by thy strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my prayer, O God;
give ear to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For strangers are risen up against me,
and oppressors seek after my soul:
they have not set God before them. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is mine helper:
the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall reward evil unto mine enemies:
cut them off in thy truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will freely sacrifice unto thee:
I will praise thy name, O Lord; for it is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath delivered me out of all trouble:
and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear to my prayer, O God;
and hide not thyself from my supplication.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Attend unto me, and hear me:
I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked:
for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is sore pained within me:
and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me,
and horror hath overwhelmed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove!
for then would I fly away, and be at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues:
for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof:
mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wickedness is in the midst thereof:
deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: but it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We took sweet counsel together,
and walked unto the house of God in company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let death seize upon them,
and let them go down quick into hell:
for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, I will call upon God; and the Lord shall save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud:
and he shall hear my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me:
for there were many with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah.
Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him:
he hath broken his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart:
his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee:
he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up;
he fighting daily oppresseth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine enemies would daily swallow me up:
for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust;
I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every day they wrest my words:
all their thoughts are against me for evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They gather themselves together,
they hide themselves,
they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall they escape by iniquity?
in thine anger cast down the people, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou tellest my wanderings:
put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I cry unto thee, then shall mine enemies turn back:
this I know; for God is for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God will I praise his word:
in the Lord will I praise his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God have I put my trust:
I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy vows are upon me, O God:
I will render praises unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou hast delivered my soul from death:
wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling,
that I may walk before God in the light of the living?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me:
for my soul trusteth in thee:
yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge,
until these calamities be overpast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cry unto God most high;
unto God that performeth all things for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall send from heaven, and save me
from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah.
God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul is among lions:
and I lie even among them that are set on fire,
even the sons of men,
whose teeth are spears and arrows,
and their tongue a sharp sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;
let thy glory be above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed:
I will sing and give praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people:
I will sing unto thee among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thy mercy is great unto the heavens,
and thy truth unto the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens:
let thy glory be above all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation?
do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, in heart ye work wickedness;
ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are estranged from the womb:
they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their poison is like the poison of a serpent:
they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which will not hearken to the voice of charmers,
charming never so wisely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth:
break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them melt away as waters which run continually:
when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away:
like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before your pots can feel the thorns,
he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance:
he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that a man shall say,
Verily there is a reward for the righteous:
verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God:
defend me from them that rise up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,
and save me from bloody men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They run and prepare themselves without my fault:
awake to help me, and behold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou therefore, O Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen:
be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening:
they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, they belch out with their mouth:
swords are in their lips:
for who, say they, doth hear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But thou, O Lord, shalt laugh at them;
thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of his strength will I wait upon thee:
for God is my defence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The God of my mercy shall prevent me:
God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride:
and for cursing and lying which they speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be:
and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And at evening let them return;
and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them wander up and down for meat,
and grudge if they be not satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing:
for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased;
O turn thyself to us again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it:
heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast shewed thy people hard things:
thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee,
that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That thy beloved may be delivered;
save with thy right hand, and hear me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice,
I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe:
Philistia, triumph thou because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me into the strong city?
who will lead me into Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off?
and thou, O God, which didst not go out with our armies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us help from trouble:
for vain is the help of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through God we shall do valiantly:
for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed:
lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou hast been a shelter for me,
and a strong tower from the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever:
I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou, O God, hast heard my vows:
thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou wilt prolong the king’s life:
and his years as many generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall abide before God for ever:
O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever,
that I may daily perform my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly my soul waiteth upon God:
from him cometh my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He only is my rock and my salvation;
he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will ye imagine mischief against a man?
ye shall be slain all of you:
as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They only consult to cast him down from his excellency:
they delight in lies:
they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul, wait thou only upon God;
for my expectation is from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He only is my rock and my salvation:
he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God is my salvation and my glory:
the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Surely men of low degree are vanity,
and men of high degree are a lie:
to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust not in oppression,
and become not vain in robbery:
if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy:
for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
to see thy power and thy glory,
so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because thy lovingkindness is better than life,
my lips shall praise thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus will I bless thee while I live:
I will lift up my hands in thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness;
and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when I remember thee upon my bed,
and meditate on thee in the night watches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because thou hast been my help,
therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul followeth hard after thee:
thy right hand upholdeth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall fall by the sword:
they shall be a portion for foxes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer:
preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked;
from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who whet their tongue like a sword,
and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they may shoot in secret at the perfect:
suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search:
both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God shall shoot at them
with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves:
all that see them shall flee away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God;
for they shall wisely consider of his doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him;
and all the upright in heart shall glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion:
and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O thou that hearest prayer,
unto thee shall all flesh come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Iniquities prevail against me:
as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man whom thou choosest,
and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts:
we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
which by his strength setteth fast the mountains;
being girded with power:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which stilleth the noise of the seas,
the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens:
thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it:
thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water:
thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly:
thou settlest the furrows thereof:
thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou crownest the year with thy goodness;
and thy paths drop fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness:
and the little hills rejoice on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
sing forth the honour of his name:
make his praise glorious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works!
through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee;
they shall sing to thy name. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come and see the works of God:
he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned the sea into dry land:
they went through the flood on foot:
there did we rejoice in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations:
let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O bless our God, ye people,
and make the voice of his praise to be heard:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which holdeth our soul in life,
and suffereth not our feet to be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou, O God, hast proved us:
thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou broughtest us into the net;
thou laidst affliction upon our loins.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will go into thy house with burnt offerings:
I will pay thee my vows,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which my lips have uttered,
and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams;
I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come and hear, all ye that fear God,
and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried unto him with my mouth,
and he was extolled with my tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I regard iniquity in my heart,
the Lord will not hear me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but verily God hath heard me;
he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be God,
which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God be merciful unto us, and bless us;
and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That thy way may be known upon earth,
thy saving health among all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the people praise thee, O God;
let all the people praise thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let the people praise thee, O God;
let all the people praise thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then shall the earth yield her increase;
and God, even our own God, shall bless us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God shall bless us;
and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered:
let them also that hate him flee before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As smoke is driven away, so drive them away:
as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But let the righteous be glad;
let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing unto God, sing praises to his name:
extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH,
and rejoice before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows,
is God in his holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God setteth the solitary in families:
he bringeth out those which are bound with chains:
but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people,
when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God:
even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain,
whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy congregation hath dwelt therein:
thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord gave the word:
great was the company of those that published it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings of armies did flee apace:
and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though ye have lien among the pots,
yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver,
and her feathers with yellow gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Almighty scattered kings in it,
it was white as snow in Salmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan;
an high hill as the hill of Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels:
the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men;
yea, for the rebellious also, that the Lord God might dwell among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits,
even the God of our salvation. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that is our God is the God of salvation;
and unto God the Lord belong the issues from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God shall wound the head of his enemies,
and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan,
I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies,
and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have seen thy goings, O God;
even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after;
among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless ye God in the congregations,
even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is little Benjamin with their ruler,
the princes of Judah and their council,
the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy God hath commanded thy strength:
strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rebuke the company of spearmen,
the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people,
till every one submit himself with pieces of silver:
scatter thou the people that delight in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes shall come out of Egypt;
Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth;
O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old;
lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe ye strength unto God:
his excellency is over Israel,
and his strength is in the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places:
the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people.
Blessed be God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing:
I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried:
mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head:
they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty:
then I restored that which I took not away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, thou knowest my foolishness;
and my sins are not hid from thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my sake:
let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because for thy sake I have borne reproach;
shame hath covered my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am become a stranger unto my brethren,
and an alien unto my mother’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up;
and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting,
that was to my reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made sackcloth also my garment;
and I became a proverb to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that sit in the gate speak against me;
and I was the song of the drunkards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Lord, in an acceptable time:
O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me,
in the truth of thy salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink:
let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let not the waterflood overflow me,
neither let the deep swallow me up,
and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me, O Lord; for thy lovingkindness is good:
turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And hide not thy face from thy servant;
for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it:
deliver me because of mine enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour:
mine adversaries are all before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They gave me also gall for my meat;
and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their table become a snare before them:
and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not;
and make their loins continually to shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out thine indignation upon them,
and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let their habitation be desolate;
and let none dwell in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten;
and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Add iniquity unto their iniquity:
and let them not come into thy righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be blotted out of the book of the living,
and not be written with the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am poor and sorrowful:
let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise the name of God with a song,
and will magnify him with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also shall please the Lord better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The humble shall see this, and be glad:
and your heart shall live that seek God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord heareth the poor,
and despiseth not his prisoners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heaven and earth praise him,
the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah:
that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The seed also of his servants shall inherit it:
and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make haste, O God, to deliver me;
make haste to help me, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul:
let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee:
and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am poor and needy:
make haste unto me, O God:
thou art my help and my deliverer;
O Lord, make no tarrying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust:
let me never be put to confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape:
incline thine ear unto me, and save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort:
thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked,
out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou art my hope, O Lord God:
thou art my trust from my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By thee have I been holden up from the womb:
thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels:
my praise shall be continually of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am as a wonder unto many;
but thou art my strong refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast me not off in the time of old age;
forsake me not when my strength faileth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For mine enemies speak against me;
and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, God hath forsaken him:
persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, be not far from me:
O my God, make haste for my help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul;
let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will hope continually,
and will yet praise thee more and more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day;
for I know not the numbers thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will go in the strength of the Lord God:
I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, thou hast taught me from my youth:
and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things:
O God, who is like unto thee!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again,
and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt increase my greatness,
and comfort me on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God:
unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee;
and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long:
for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give the king thy judgments, O God,
and thy righteousness unto the king’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall judge thy people with righteousness,
and thy poor with judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains shall bring peace to the people,
and the little hills, by righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall judge the poor of the people,
he shall save the children of the needy,
and shall break in pieces the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure,
throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass:
as showers that water the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days shall the righteous flourish;
and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,
and from the river unto the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him;
and his enemies shall lick the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents:
the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, all kings shall fall down before him:
all nations shall serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth;
the poor also, and him that hath no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall spare the poor and needy,
and shall save the souls of the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence:
and precious shall their blood be in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
His name shall endure for ever:
his name shall be continued as long as the sun:
and men shall be blessed in him:
all nations shall call him blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord God,
the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly God is good to Israel,
even to such as are of a clean heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my feet were almost gone;
my steps had well nigh slipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I was envious at the foolish,
when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there are no bands in their death:
but their strength is firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are not in trouble as other men;
neither are they plagued like other men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain;
violence covereth them as a garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their eyes stand out with fatness:
they have more than heart could wish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression:
they speak loftily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set their mouth against the heavens,
and their tongue walketh through the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore his people return hither:
and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they say, How doth God know?
and is there knowledge in the most High?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world;
they increase in riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain,
and washed my hands in innocency.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the day long have I been plagued,
and chastened every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, I will speak thus;
behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I thought to know this,
it was too painful for me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I went into the sanctuary of God;
then understood I their end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely thou didst set them in slippery places:
thou castedst them down into destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment!
they are utterly consumed with terrors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a dream when one awaketh;
so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus my heart was grieved,
and I was pricked in my reins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So foolish was I, and ignorant:
I was as a beast before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless I am continually with thee:
thou hast holden me by my right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel,
and afterward receive me to glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom have I in heaven but thee?
and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh and my heart faileth:
but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish:
thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is good for me to draw near to God:
I have put my trust in the Lord God,
that I may declare all thy works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever?
why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations;
even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations;
they set up their ensigns for signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have cast fire into thy sanctuary,
they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together:
they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet:
neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, how long shall the adversary reproach?
shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand?
pluck it out of thy bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is my King of old,
working salvation in the midst of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength:
thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces,
and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood:
thou driedst up mighty rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The day is thine, the night also is thine:
thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast set all the borders of the earth:
thou hast made summer and winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Lord,
and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked:
forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have respect unto the covenant:
for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O let not the oppressed return ashamed:
let the poor and needy praise thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O God, plead thine own cause:
remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forget not the voice of thine enemies:
the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks:
for that thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved:
I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly:
and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lift not up your horn on high:
speak not with a stiff neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For promotion cometh neither from the east,
nor from the west, nor from the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God is the judge:
he putteth down one, and setteth up another.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I will declare for ever;
I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off;
but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Judah is God known:
his name is great in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Salem also is his tabernacle,
and his dwelling place in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There brake he the arrows of the bow,
the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep:
and none of the men of might have found their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou, even thou, art to be feared:
and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven;
the earth feared, and was still,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when God arose to judgment,
to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee:
the remainder of wrath shalt thou restrain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Vow, and pay unto the Lord your God:
let all that be round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall cut off the spirit of princes:
he is terrible to the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cried unto God with my voice,
even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord:
my sore ran in the night, and ceased not:
my soul refused to be comforted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I remembered God, and was troubled:
I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou holdest mine eyes waking:
I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have considered the days of old,
the years of ancient times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call to remembrance my song in the night:
I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the Lord cast off for ever?
and will he be favourable no more?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is his mercy clean gone for ever?
doth his promise fail for evermore?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hath God forgotten to be gracious?
hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I said, This is my infirmity:
but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will remember the works of the Lord:
surely I will remember thy wonders of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meditate also of all thy work,
and talk of thy doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary:
who is so great a God as our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art the God that doest wonders:
thou hast declared thy strength among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people,
the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee;
they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound:
thine arrows also went abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven:
the lightnings lightened the world:
the earth trembled and shook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters,
and thy footsteps are not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou leddest thy people like a flock
by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O my people, to my law:
incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will open my mouth in a parable:
I will utter dark sayings of old:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which we have heard and known,
and our fathers have told us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will not hide them from their children,
shewing to the generation to come the praises of the Lord,
and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he established a testimony in Jacob,
and appointed a law in Israel,
which he commanded our fathers,
that they should make them known to their children:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
that they might set their hope in God,
and not forget the works of God,
but keep his commandments:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and might not be as their fathers,
a stubborn and rebellious generation;
a generation that set not their heart aright,
and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows,
turned back in the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They kept not the covenant of God,
and refused to walk in his law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and forgat his works,
and his wonders that he had shewed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers,
in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through;
and he made the waters to stand as an heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the daytime also he led them with a cloud,
and all the night with a light of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He clave the rocks in the wilderness,
and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought streams also out of the rock,
and caused waters to run down like rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they sinned yet more against him
by provoking the most High in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they tempted God in their heart
by asking meat for their lust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, they spake against God;
they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
because they believed not in God,
and trusted not in his salvation:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though he had commanded the clouds from above,
and opened the doors of heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and had rained down manna upon them to eat,
and had given them of the corn of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man did eat angels’ food:
he sent them meat to the full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven:
and by his power he brought in the south wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rained flesh also upon them as dust,
and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he let it fall in the midst of their camp,
round about their habitations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they did eat, and were well filled:
for he gave them their own desire;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they were not estranged from their lust.
But while their meat was yet in their mouths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them,
and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all this they sinned still,
and believed not for his wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore their days did he consume in vanity,
and their years in trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he slew them, then they sought him:
and they returned and enquired early after God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they remembered that God was their rock,
and the high God their redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth,
and they lied unto him with their tongues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their heart was not right with him,
neither were they stedfast in his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he, being full of compassion,
forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not:
yea, many a time turned he his anger away,
and did not stir up all his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he remembered that they were but flesh;
a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness,
and grieve him in the desert!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, they turned back and tempted God,
and limited the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They remembered not his hand,
nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How he had wrought his signs in Egypt,
and his wonders in the field of Zoan:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and had turned their rivers into blood;
and their floods, that they could not drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them;
and frogs, which destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller,
and their labour unto the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He destroyed their vines with hail,
and their sycomore trees with frost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave up their cattle also to the hail,
and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger,
wrath, and indignation, and trouble,
by sending evil angels among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and smote all the firstborn in Egypt;
the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but made his own people to go forth like sheep,
and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he led them on safely, so that they feared not:
but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary,
even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cast out the heathen also before them,
and divided them an inheritance by line,
and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God,
and kept not his testimonies:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers:
they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they provoked him to anger with their high places,
and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When God heard this, he was wroth,
and greatly abhorred Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,
the tent which he placed among men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and delivered his strength into captivity,
and his glory into the enemy’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave his people over also unto the sword;
and was wroth with his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fire consumed their young men;
and their maidens were not given to marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their priests fell by the sword;
and their widows made no lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep,
and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts:
he put them to a perpetual reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph,
and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but chose the tribe of Judah,
the mount Zion which he loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he built his sanctuary like high palaces,
like the earth which he hath established for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chose David also his servant,
and took him from the sheepfolds:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people,
and Israel his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart;
and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the heaven,
the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem;
and there was none to bury them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are become a reproach to our neighbours,
a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord? wilt thou be angry for ever?
shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee,
and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have devoured Jacob,
and laid waste his dwelling place.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name:
and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore should the heathen say, Where is their God?
let him be known among the heathen in our sight
by the revenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
and render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom
their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever:
we will shew forth thy praise to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength,
and come and save us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of hosts,
how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou feedest them with the bread of tears;
and givest them tears to drink in great measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours:
and our enemies laugh among themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt:
thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou preparedst room before it,
and didst cause it to take deep root,
and it filled the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hills were covered with the shadow of it,
and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She sent out her boughs unto the sea,
and her branches unto the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why hast thou then broken down her hedges,
so that all they which pass by the way do pluck her?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The boar out of the wood doth waste it,
and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts:
look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted,
and the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is burned with fire, it is cut down:
they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand,
upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So will not we go back from thee:
quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sing aloud unto God our strength:
make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel,
the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow up the trumpet in the new moon,
in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this was a statute for Israel,
and a law of the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt:
where I heard a language that I understood not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I removed his shoulder from the burden:
his hands were delivered from the pots.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee:
O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
there shall no strange god be in thee;
neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt:
open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my people would not hearken to my voice;
and Israel would none of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust:
and they walked in their own counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my people had hearkened unto me,
and Israel had walked in my ways!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I should soon have subdued their enemies,
and turned my hand against their adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The haters of the Lord should have submitted themselves unto him:
but their time should have endured for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat:
and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God standeth in the congregation of the mighty;
he judgeth among the gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will ye judge unjustly,
and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Defend the poor and fatherless:
do justice to the afflicted and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver the poor and needy:
rid them out of the hand of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I have said, Ye are gods;
and all of you are children of the most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But ye shall die like men,
and fall like one of the princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, O God, judge the earth:
for thou shalt inherit all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep not thou silence, O God:
hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult:
and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have taken crafty counsel against thy people,
and consulted against thy hidden ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation;
that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they have consulted together with one consent:
they are confederate against thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites;
of Moab, and the Hagarenes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek;
the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Assur also is joined with them:
they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do unto them as unto the Midianites;
as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
